title: 114_hr4965
content: The Act is titled the "Disclosure; and Encouragement of Verification, Innovation, Cleaning, and Efficiency Act of 2016". It includes a reporting requirement for design and reprocessing instruction changes. SEC. 2 amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to include a reporting requirement for device design changes. Manufacturers must notify the FDA before making changes to a device's design or reprocessing instructions. The Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act is amended to include a reporting requirement for device manufacturers violating communication requirements to foreign health care providers. Manufacturers must notify the FDA within 5 days of making such communication. The Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act now includes a reporting requirement for device manufacturers who communicate changes or safety concerns to foreign healthcare providers. Manufacturers or their affiliates must notify the FDA within 5 days of such communication. The Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act now requires device manufacturers to report changes or safety concerns communicated to foreign healthcare providers. This reporting obligation applies when one business entity controls or has the power to control another entity, or when a third party controls both entities. SEC. 4. Rapid assessment tests for proper reprocessing. The amendment to the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act includes a definition of a reusable device as one that is intended for multiple uses and requires sanitization for safety. Additionally, a rapid assessment test is added to ensure proper reprocessing of such devices. The Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act is amended to include regulations for rapid assessment tests for reusable devices, requiring validated instructions for use and validation data. The Secretary will periodically update the list of rapid assessment tests for reusable devices and will not accept notifications for clearance of tests on the list without proper instructions and validation data.
